Reports.Report: This hotel has a prime location on the Kerkstraat, just off the Leidsestraat and the Leidseplein and within walking distance of all major tourist attractions. It is also located next to one of the best steak and rib restaurants of Amsterdam.

The bedrooms are in very good condition and are small in size but in good condition. The bathrooms are exceptional for a property of this category, with power showers, modern pristine facilities, and modern tiling. Some bathrooms even have double power showers.

Due to its city centre location, this hotel has no restaurant, only a breakfast room. This room is located on the ground floor but is currently accessed via an external door. It is a very bright and airy room and decorated entirely in white with a large floor to ceiling window overlooking the street.
This is a brand new hotel and the exterior reflects the fact that it has recently been completely renovated.
The lobby is very small and incorporates a small reception area and a bench. It is bright and airy and leads to a larger hallway which leads to the bedrooms and very, very wide staircase.
This is a great, brand new hotel in the centre of Amsterdam offering good accommodation and a prime location. jg/2009

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: The bedrooms are in very good condition and are small in size but in good condition. The bathrooms are exceptional for a property of this category, with power showers, modern pristine facilities, and modern tiling. Some bathrooms even have double power showers.

Reports.Report: Located in the outskirts of Amsterdam in a residential area, this hotel is actually on the main ring road of Amsterdam with easy access to the airport and city centre. The metro is 10 mins walk away.

The medium-sized bedrooms are in very good condition. There is a very tasteful, regal theme throughout, with all rooms containing a print of a royal crest and all furniture bearing a crown motif. The colour scheme is predominantly royal blue and all rooms have a small seating area and desk. Those bedrooms with French patio doors have been altered so that the doors only open a couple of inches.

Whilst the front half of the restaurant maintains a light, airy and casual feel, the back half is more formal. Between the front and back of the restaurant is a brasserie-type room with wooden floors. The bar is also here. The whole atmosphere is that of a ship and is very easy on the eye.
This hotel was opened in 1992 and is a low rise modern building.
The lobby is small and furnished in simple, modern style.
This hotel is suitable for all markets, especially those on a budget looking for a hotel that does not resemble a budget hotel. 030807JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam, close to the Rembrandtsplein, the main shopping area and tourist attractions.

The hotel has benefitted from a complete renovation which was finished this year and now offers 4 star accommodation with new luxurious beds, televisions and other new facilities expected from a 4 star property. The bathrooms are also in very good condition.

The restaurant is located on the ground floor and all meals are served in this bright and modern space. Lunch and dinner is from a predominantly Dutch menu and the casual restaurant is popular with both hotel guests and the general public
It is a modern, purposefully built hotel.

The lobby is medium sized and was also renovated this year. It now offers luxurious Italian seating, a modern bar leading to its popular restaurant, a communal reading table and of course, the reception area.
This property is in an excellent location and following its total renovation is a wonderful small and personal 4 star hotel which comes highly recommended. jg/07/2010

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: The hotel has benefitted from a complete renovation which was finished this year and now offers 4 star accommodation with new luxurious beds, televisions and other new facilities expected from a 4 star property. The bathrooms are also in very good condition.

The bedrooms are in very good condition and have a blue/ green colour scheme and pale wood furniture. They vary in size from medium to large and all bedrooms have attractive paintings that add colour to the rooms. The curtains are blue, red and green giving it a cosy feel and all the rooms vary in shape. The bathrooms are also in very good condition and are of a good size with a pale yellow and grey decor.

Reports.Report: This hotel has a prime location in Amsterdam, opposite Central Station and close to Chinatown, the infamous red light district and most major tourist attractions that Amsterdam has to offer.

The bedrooms are superb and as the hotel has only recently opened, they are in excellent condition. They are spaciously large, decorated in dark wood and blue and offer all the facilities one would expect from this category hotel. The bathrooms are also in excellent condition however, they are with large showers only and no bath.

The restaurant is located on the upper ground floor and is very large. As this is a historical building, it is also a listed building and therefore, much of the original decor still exists so this room, while large and spacious, also benefits from the original woodwork found throughout the property. At night, the restaurant serves a predominantly fish menu and for breakfast, offers a very extensive buffet. The hotel also has a popular bar which serves an extensive snack menu as well as numerous hot and cold drinks and cocktails.

The exterior of this building is very unique - it stands on a street corner and and resembles the helm of a great ship. It has many carvings engraved all over as well as numerous gargoyles and does not resemble a hotel whatsoever

The lobby, which is reached by a small staircase, is small and has only a concierge desk, however, a main featur of the hotel is the original ceiling above the lobby. There is a small reception located off the lobby where guests are invited to sit down whilst checking in. Just behind the concierge desk is the bar.

This is a lovely deluxe property with an excellent location and comes highly recommended. It is a historical builiding and has some lovely original touches, eg the original lifts that were used which had no doors so you would simply step in them and step out. These are still working but encased behind glass. In fact, the entire hotel is like a museum and momento of the past. jg/04/2008

Reports.Report: This property has recently moved and is now located near the city centre at the back of Central Station, on the other side of the water. It is accessible via a free ferry and bus service and takes approx. 10 minutes.
The bedrooms are small in size and are actually cabins, as the hotel is a boat. The multi-bedded rooms are basic and clean in bunkbed style.
The restaurant is located on the ground floor of the boat and is open all day. There is also a popular bar and pool table and an extensive buffet breakfast is served.
This is a large, white boat.
The lobby is basic and medium in size and leads into the restaurant.

The Botel offers unique accommodation in Amsterdam. Please note: this property has recently moved - as of 21 January 2008 it is now located near the city centre at the back of Central Station, on the other side of the water. It is accessible via a free ferry and bus service. 0208JG

Reports.Report: The most prestigious hotel in Amsterdam is located on the Amstel river, close to the famous Carre Theatre and not far from all of the touristic attractions that this famous city has to offer.

The bedrooms are large, luxurious and very comfortable with either a blue or red colour scheme and offer all the facilities one would expect from a hotel of its calibre. They are in very good condition as are the large and luxurious bathrooms, with an extensive bar selection in each room.

The famous Michelin star restaurant is located on the lower ground floor and so has delightful views over the River Amstel. It offers a superb, international menu with very attentive staff. All meals are served in this restaurant although the bar also serves an a la carte menu which is more substantial than most bar menus.
This is a very traditional, large building which is very impressive and a landmark of Amsterdam.

The lobby and the rest of the public areas are also traditional in style and exude elegance and luxury and class. The lobby is large with gold plated adornings, attractive cornices and the lounge area is located off the lobby with wonderful views of Amsterdam and the River Amstel. Afternoon tea and other beverages are served here.

This hotel is without doubt the best in the city, and so is used predominantly by both local and international governments and the entertainment world. The health spa also has a lovely advantage in that there is a lovely sun terrace which overlooks the Amstel River and where people can relax with a drink or sunbathe, weather permitting. This hotel comes highly recommended for those with the budget to match. 201207JG

Reports.Report: Located in the heart of Amsterdam on Damrak, this hotel is very close to Dam Square and within walking distance of Central Station as well as the Kalverstraat and most major tourist attractions.

The bedrooms all vary in size due to the age of the building but they have all been renovated and are now in very good condition. The colour scheme is predominantly rust with cherrywood furniture and all rooms have air conditioning, LCD televisions and high speed internet. The bathrooms are also in good condition, and some have been renovated with the remainder due to be renovated over the course of the year. The renovated bathrooms are very modern with dark wooden flooring, with silver and pristine white finishing on the walls and in the showers.

Located on the ground floor, the restaurant overlooks the busy street where one can watch the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. It serves a traditional Dutch menu and is traditional in style. There is also a brasserie which serves light snacks all day
The hotel is located above its famous pavement cafe on a busy street. The exterior is a 1900 building.
The lobby is actually very small as the majority of the ground floor space is taken up by the cafe.
This hotel is excellently located and has benefited from its much needed renovation to become a hotel worthy of its first rate classification. Ideal for all markets. 290807jg

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam, a few steps from Central Station and close to the famous Kalverstraat, the pedestrianised shopping street. It is also close to all major tourist attractions including the Anne Frank House, Dam Square and the exclusive Jordaan area.

The bedrooms are all extremely modern and comfortable with the unique feature of having the sink in the bedroom behind an attractive partition. Due to its rebranding from Ramada, it was renovated in 2004 but it still offers very pleasant and comfortable accomodation.
The restaurant is located on the ground floor and currently serves breakfast only. It was renovated in 2004 and is a large and bright room.
This is a modern hotel with a bright facade.

The large lobby has recently been redecorated and is more up-to-date with large paintings adorning the walls, large and welcoming black and red leather armchairs, a red banquette and a typically Dutch communal table with red and green velvet chairs, offering ample seating space in a relaxed environment.
This is probably one of the best 3 star properties in Amsterdam with a superb location and ideal for all types of travellers. 07/2006/jg

Reports.Report: Located in an exclusive residential area in the south of Amsterdam, 12 minutes walk to the Museumplein and Leidseplein.
The bedrooms are medium-sized and are all decorated individually. Furthermore, they and the bathrooms are in excellent condition for a 2 star hotel, and are worthy of a 3 star classification.
The breakfast room is located on the first floor and has wooden flooring, purple chairs and an art nouveau feature fireplace.
A traditional building, built in 1899.
The lobby is small but modern and welcoming.
An excellent 2 star hotel worthy of 3 stars, with friendly staff and an owner who takes a lot of pride in his property. Ideally located in a quiet part of Amsterdam. 170908JG

Reports.Report: Located close to Amsterdam's famous zoo, this hotel is approx. 20 minutes walk or only a short tram ride away from Central Station and close to all the main attractions of this city.

The bedrooms are large in size and quite minimalist although unique in style with drop down silver lighting. They are in good condition, as are the bathrooms. Rooms are decorated with warm colours and wooden floors.

The restaurant has recently been renovated in the style of a French brasserie and now features attractive wooden floorboards. It serves international cuisine and overlooks the forecourt of the hotel. In the summer, there is a terrace where one can have a drink outside.

The hotel has a unique exterior due to the fact that it is an historic building. It was originally built in the 1890s for use as a Roman Catholic orphanage. It is traditional in style and is reached by a small forecourt.
The lobby is large and bare with its main feature being the recently restored impressive iron staircase.

This is a perfect base for those travelling on a budget. It is slightly different to most hotels in Amsterdam as it has some nice grounds and extra facilities and yet is just minutes from the city centre. 250908JG

Reports.Report: This property has an excellent location in the city centre of Amsterdam, on the beautiful Keizersgracht, and around the corner from the world renowned Rembrandtsplein, with its bars, restaurants, coffee shops and nightclubs.
The bedrooms are very basic and tired and could do with some paintwork and renovations but all have private facilities and televisions.

The hotel has no restaurant but its breakfast room is also the reception area and overlooks the beautiful gracht. This is a traditional, grand building with lovely features such as marble fireplaces and sash windows although these are not taken advantage of.
A beautiful, traditional exterior in keeping with the rest of the buildiings on this beautiful gracht (canal)

The lobby is only reachable via a steep staircase so not suitable for elderly people or those with any walking difficulties. It also houses the breakfast room and is a lovely, bright and large room where you can envisage its former state in all its glory as it must have been a very grand building when first built.

This is a very basic hotel in what used to be a grand building with its most redeeming feature being its fantastic location. It is most suitable for those who are happy to have a bed for a night and who will not be disappointed with the basic features and state of the accommodation.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to the city centre, which can be reached by metro or tram #2, approx. 10 minutes walk from hotel. It is also close to the motorway giving easy access to the airport and the rest of the Netherlands.

The bedrooms are in immaculate condition and are very luxurious with wooden flooring and an earthy decor of cream, beige and brown. There are differing textures on the walls and bed covers and all bedrooms have a flat screen television, wooden lamps and attractive art on the walls. The bathrooms are also in excellent condition with grey slate tiled walls, modern white features and glass shower screens.
The restaurant is open plan and leads off from the lobby. It is a large and airy space with attractive booths for more intimate dining.
This is a modern, purpose-built hotel with an eyecatching mosaic-style design on the exterior.
The lobby is large, bright, airy and fairly modern in design with a video wall.
This is a lovely new addition to Amsterdam and offers luxurious accommodation, suitable for all. 170908JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located right in the heart of Amsterdam, close to the Leidseplein, the Holland Casino, the Rijks and Van Gogh museums, and most tourist attractions. It is also located in the heart of the cities nightlife.
The bedrooms are small and basic but clean and comfortable and in good condition. The single rooms have shared facilites so please beware.
The breakfast room is small and located on the lower ground floor but the hotel offers quite a generous breakfast.
This is an attractive, old building in keeping with its surroundings
The lobby is very small with limited seating and is accessed by a few steep steps.
This hotel has a prime location in the centre of Amsterdam and is perfect for those wanting a budget hotel in a sought after position. jg/11/2008

Reports.Report: Excellently located in the centre of Amsterdam, opposite Central Station and so within walking distance of all major attractions and shopping and entertainment areas.

The bedrooms are all in very good condition and range from small to medium in size. Some have special features such as being split level or having exposed wooden beams etc. They all have rose and gold bedspreads and blue and gold curtains, with rosewood effect furniture. The bathrooms, which only have a shower, are also in excellent condition, with granite floor and hair-dryers.

This is an extension of the lobby and serves breakfast only. It is designed in the style of a train restaurant car with banquette for tables, decorated in green and wood and with pictures of trains as well as luggage racks and a train track along the floor.
This is a traditional building in keeping with its neighbouring buildings in the typical Dutch style.

The lobby is small and narrow but completely refurbished and very attractive with a mahogany effect reception desk. There are train tracks painted on the floor which lead to the breakfast room and elevators.
This hotel is without doubt one of the best 3 star hotels in Amsterdam, and with an excellent, central position is perfect for all markets. 040208JG

Reports.Report: This hotel has a prime location in the heart of Amsterdam and is situated close to Central Station with easy access to the main shopping street 'De Kalverstraat'. It is also within walking distance of most of the tourist attractions the city has to offer.
The rooms are small and are decorated in apple green in a classical style. They are comfortable and clean while the bathrooms are small, simple, up-to-date and in good condition.
There is no restaurant apart from the breakfast room, which is on the ground floor.
The exterior of this building is very traditional as the area consists of the typical Dutch townhouses so familiar in Amsterdam city centre.
The lobby is large with limited seating. There is also a small bar adjacent, which is very popular with in-house guests but is only open in the late afternoon and evenings.
This popular hotel is a good three star property which offers a reasonable level of comfort in a prime location. 120907JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the south of Amsterdam, close to the motorway on the inside of the ring road. It is 10 minutes by tram #1 from the Leidseplein and 20 minutes by tram #1 and #17 from Central Station. It is also close to Lelylaan train station from where the train to Schipol takes less than 10 minutes. It is also within walking distance of the beautiful Vondel Park, which in itself is 20 minutes by foot from the Leidseplein, PC Hoofstraat and the Museumplein.

The medium-sized bedrooms all have double glazing and have recently been redecorated to a very high standard with bright colours, predominantly reds and yellows. The bathrooms are also in a very good condition but have a shower only.

The restaurant is located off the lobby and is very cosy with dark wooden furniture. The bar is also incorporated into the restaurant with a juke box and plasma television on the wall. The restaurant is open throughout the whole day and offers a Dutch/International menu. In the summer months, there is also a small patio where one can have a drink or something to eat.
This is a purpose-built, modern building.
The lobby is small with limited seating but there is also a small lounge/library which offers further comfortable seating and free Internet access.
This is a lovely little property, offering the personal touch, ideally located away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre but within very easy reach of the main attractions. jg/07/2008

Reports.Report: This hotel is ideally located on Amsterdams ring road, off exit S111, and within walking distance to the metro, which takes 10 minutes to Central Station and 5 minutes to the RAI Congress Centre.

The bedrooms are all medium in size with red carpets and either yellow and red or pastel coloured curtains and matching bed covers. They are furnished with a pale wooden desk, wardrobe and headboard and are in very good condition. The bathrooms are also in very good condition with white tiling, black trim and a grey tiled floor.

The restaurant is on the ground floor, adjacent to the lobby and is large and bright with a brasserie feel about it. It has an attractive and warm colour scheme with a red carpet, pale wooden tables, blue chairs and even a juke box. All meals are offered here including a hot buffet breakfast.
This is a purpose-built, modern building.
The lobby is small and leads directly to the welcoming bar and restaurant area.
This is a good product and offers excellent value for money. 07/08 jg

Reports.Report: This hotel is situated by the Overtoom which, although not in the heart of the city, is a 20 minute walk to the Leidseplein or a 5 minute tram ride away (tram 1 and tram 17 goes to Central Station in about 15 minutes). The Overtoom itself has numerous restaurants, shops and bars which are popular with the locals and is a short walk from the famous Vondel park.
Both guestrooms and bathrooms vary in size and colour schemes, but they are nothing fancy and are in very basic condition.
The breakfast room boasts an old style atmosphere with typical Dutch style tiled floor and tall dark wooden wall panelling. The bar is kept in the same style and is connected to the lobby.
The hotel is located in a modern corner building typical to the area.
The lobby is small in size and opens onto the breakfast room and hotel bar.
This property is an acceptable choice for those on a budget and those who want to be close to the city centre but in a more typical Amsterdam environment. 180707NN

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the very centre of Amsterdam, opposite the train station and within walking distance of the canals, with their boutique shops and cafe culture, the Red Light District, flower market and most of the tourist attractions this city has to offer.

The bedrooms are in very good condition and are decorated in brilliant white with a splash of colour on one wall in the form of a giant photograph, showing either sea or grass. The rooms are small to medium in size with very modern furniture. The bathrooms are also in brilliant white and are in very good condition with modern styling facilities.

This is located on the ground floor with a separate street entrance and so serves not only hotel guests but the public also. It offers a buffet breakfast and light meals for lunch and dinner and is decorated in the style of a bistro with wooden flooring, wooden tables and modern leather seating.

Although the original building was torn down and this is a brand new building, due to the strict building laws in Amsterdam, the new building had to be in the old, traditional style to fit in with the neighbourhood.
The lobby is medium-sized and airy with a black and white tiled floor, terracotta leather chairs and pale blue beams on the ceiling, giving it a modern style with a traditional twist.

This hotel is excellently located in the heart of Amsterdam and opposite Central Station making it a 15 minute train ride to the airport. It has a great location for visiting not only Amsterdam but also the rest of the country. It is suitable for all markets and comes highly recommended. 120908JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam, less than 5 minutes walk from Central Station and close to the heart of the Red Light District. It is also within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions that this exciting city has to offer.
The bedrooms are of a higher standard than one would expect of a one star hotel and are small- to medium-sized. All have private facilities and are basic but clean and well kept.
This is a traditional building.
The lobby is medium-sized, long and narrow with limited seating and no discerning features.
This hotel has an ideal location and is perfect for those on a budget. Please note however that this hotel does not serve breakfast. 01/07/08JG

Reports.Report: Located in the heart of Amsterdam on one of its most beautiful and famous canals, this hotel is within walking distance of all tourist attractions as well as within walking distance of the Central Station.

The bedrooms all vary in style and are in excellent condition as would be expected from this very deluxe, boutique style hotel. They are all medium to large with varying colour schemes, some with four-poster beds, and are all feng-shui friendly. The bathrooms are also unique and in excellent condition.

The restaurant is currently the most talked about eateries in Amsterdam and is located on the ground floor and lower ground floor of the hotel. It is immaculately decorated in black and white and the food is first class with much attention to detail, as is the service. The menu is a mixture of East meets West with something for all tastes and reservations are necessary.

This is a traditional hotel in keeping with the rest of the buildings on this lovely street. There is an attractive courtyard leading to the entrance of the hotel which is very discreet and which is not obviously a hotel from the outside.

The lobby is very small with the reception leading directly off the marbled lobby. In the reception area is a reception desk where guests sit on comfortable bench like seats whilst checking in, with wooden floors and beautiful flowers and vases giving a feeling of calm and tranquility.

This is currently the most talked about hotel in town and suitable for all those who like to feel at home away from home but it is very stylish and exclusive. It comes highly recommended. This hotel also offers our guests a complimentary tour of a diamond factory with limo pick up and drop off from the hotel, but this must be requested at least 24 hours in advance and is subject to availability. 28/06/08NN

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to Amsterdams ring road, so it is within easy reach for those with their own transport. However, it is also very easily accessible on public transport from the airport and city centre. The hotel itself is surrounded by fast food restaurants and a large shopping centre.

As this property only opened in June 2007, the bedrooms are in very good condition. They are all medium- to large-sized with cherry wood furniture, flat screen televisions and artwork on the walls. The bathrooms are modern and also in very good condition with black marble sinks, beige tiles and glass shower screens. All have both power showers and hand held showers and all have a bath, except the double rooms, which have very large power showers. There are safety deposit boxes large enough for laptops as well as air conditioning in all rooms, but there are no mini bars. Most twin rooms consist of two beds pushed together. All rooms are non smoking.

The restaurant is located on the first floor and serves breakfast only. Group meals are available upon request. It is a very large and spacious area with cherry wood furniture, large windows and a large, modern, buffet area.
This is a modern, purpose-built block, with a very blue exterior, giving the hotel its name.

The lobby is very large and impressive with white faux leather seating, various other forms of seating, a black and white tiled floor and very attractive ceiling lighting that constantly changes colour. In the near future, a bar will be incorporated into this area but at the time of writing, this was not yet completed.
This is a brand new hotel in Amsterdam and offers great value for money. It comes highly recommended. 100708jg

Reports.Report: This charming hotel is ideally situated along one of Amsterdam's historic and infamous canals, the Herengracht. The city's museums and entertainment centres are all within walking distance, as well as the famous Amsterdam flower market, Central Station and Rembrandtsplein.

The bedrooms were completely renovated in 2004 and are now all-inclusive, meaning that mini-bar drinks, cable TV and films are all complimentary. The bedrooms are in very good condition and are decorated in a faux art-deco style, with wooden furniture, plasma television and surround sound, burgundy curtains, a black armchair and foot stool and an art deco wardrobe. The bathrooms have also been completely renovated and are also in very good condition with black and white tiling and a power shower with extra large shower head in every room.

The hotel does not have a restaurant due to the numerous restaurants surrounding the hotel However, there is a breakfast room on the lower ground floor. This was also completely renovated in 2004 and now has a black and white tiled floor. There is some seating available on a yellow banquette and a breakfast buffet is served on an imitation Aga cooker. The wooden dressers and the Aga give a cosy and homey atmosphere, and some items are cooked on the spot e.g. pancakes, waffles etc. There is also a large table adorned with magazines and sightseeing leaflets.
It is an old building, recently cleaned and protected as one of Amsterdam's monuments.

The lobby, like the rest of the hotel, was completely renovated in 2004 and is reminiscent of the art deco era, the period in which the hotel was actually built. It has stained glass windows, wooden floors and an attractive wooden reception desk. Extending from the lobby is the lounge area, which has ample seating on multicoloured furniture, a feature fire place, a complimentary bar and an Internet corner.

This hotel is very well located and offers the guest a unique concept in as much as everything is included, from the mini bar in the rooms, to the drinks in the hotel bar and use of the Internet. The only exception is phone calls. The recent renovation of this hotel also means that it is now one of the finest first class properties in Amsterdam. NN/06/07

Reports.Report: This hotel is perfectly situated on the Rembrandtplein in the heart of the city. It is close to all the main tourist attractions and is easily accessible by tram from Central Station.

The rooms are medium-sized and were renovated in 2006 to an extremely high standard. The colour scheme is earthy with dark wood furniture, brown walls and carpet and lime green chairs, all in very good condition. The bathrooms feature dark grey slate tiles, or blue floor tiles, with large, white and square modern sinks and silver trimming, including new hairdryers. All are in very good condition.

Breakfast is served in an airy and large room that may be found on the first floor and accessible by elevator. Due to the location of this hotel, only breakfast is served although one can also eat at their sister hotel located across the square or in one of the numerous eateries located on the hotels doorstep.
The building is modern in contrast to its immediate surroundings, but seems to blend in well due to its size.
The lobby is small but cosy with ample seating on very comfortable and plump armchairs. The colours of the lobby are predominantly green and blue with dark wooden walls.
A nice hotel with an excellent location. jg/11/2010

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to Amstel station which has direct train links to Central Station and the RAI congress centre. It is also a short tram ride to the city centre and to the Arena stadium.

The hotel has moved location and been completely refurbished in 2010 and the rooms are in excellent condition and of a quality far exceeding its 3 stars. The bedrooms are medium size, very airy, benefitting from light wood furnishings, brand new bathrooms and all of the highest quality.

Their is a large restaurant with terrace on the ground floor serving an International cuisine and the hotels fashionable bar, located on the first floor, also offers typical Dutch snacks. Breakfast is served on the ground floor but may also be served on the first floor during very busy periods.
It is a brand new, modern building.
The lobby is very large with ample seating and overlooks an indoor garden complete with little waterfall. It has a modern outlook and leads to the restaurant which has seating also in the lobby area.
This is a very good 3 star hotel offering excellent accommodation and f&b outlets and comes highly recommended. jg/07/2010

Reports.Report: The hotel lies in historic surroundings close to the city's central station, the Royal Palace, flower market and the renowned Bijenkorf and Magna Plaza department stores.

The up-to-date rooms vary in size and shape due to the age of the building, but are predominantly small. They are comfortably furnished in warm colours, and the small, white tiled bathrooms include modern features.
The restaurant/breakfast room is also modern, and is pleasantly furnished.
This building consists of traditional Dutch town houses, therefore blending in with the surrounding architecture.
The small lobby, in contrast to the exterior, is very modern with an attractive reception desk.
This hotel is suitable for all individual clients due to its location.04/11/08JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in a prime position next to Central Station in the heart of Amsterdam.

The rooms are in exceptional condition and are medium sized with a very modern outlook. One of the key selling points of this hotel is that all bedrooms benefit from an iMac multimedia entertainment system featuring a computer with free internet access, video conferencing and satelite and terrestrial television channels. The bathrooms are also in exceptional condition and feature walk in power showers and mist free mirrors.

The Mint hotel has various food outlets - the lobby lounge which is located on the ground floor and serves a lovely but limited menu in a contemporary and timeless environment and is suitable for relaxing with a drink and a good book. The City Cafe is a large and airy contemporary restaurant overlooking one of Amsterdams famous canals where breakfast and lunch and dinner may be served. The menu is modern with Dutch and English influences and the chef is one of Hollands Masterchefs! The East Dock lounge serves light meals but offers a more "chilled" environment. It has a cocktail bar atmosphere and offers a unique "whisky library". The Sky lounge is an amazing rooftop bar and restaurant with a large terrace overlooking the beautiful city of Amsterdam. There is a long bar and a delightful menu offering International cuisine and is unique to Amsterdam.
This is a purposely built and brand new building that compliments Amsterdams skyline. It is quite an eyecatching, incredibly modern building.
The lobby is very large, modern and airy and similar to the other Mint hotels in Britain. It has floor to ceiling windows and modern furniture and fittings.

This is a great new addition to Amsterdam and has unique selling points such as iMac entertainment system, a rooftop skybar and high quality eateries. It is suitable for all markets and comes highly recommended. jg/12/2010

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to the Museumplein with its many famous museums, and is next to the Van Baerlestraat with its restaurants, cafes and shops. It is also close to the Vondel Park and the Leidseplein with its many bars and the famous Holland Casino.

The bedrooms are all medium to large and in excellent condition. This hotel offers some of the best accommodation in Amsterdam, with its trendy dark interiors, much attention to detail, and some rooms with beams, some split level and with its immaculately designed bathrooms.

The hotel restaurant is one of the most renowned throughout Amsterdam. The hotel itself used to be a school and the restaurant is housed in the former school gym and is large and bright with an open kitchen and serves predominantly Dutch/International cuisine. There is also a terrace where in the summer, drinks may be served as well as the trendy hotel bar which is very popular amongst the local Dutch inhabitants and offers an alternative atmosphere with plenty of low seating, as well as bar seating, fireplaces and music.

As the name suggests, this building used to be a school and has been restored to its former glory which is very traditional in design with a small garden at the entrance with flames lining the pathway.

The lobby is very attractive with exposed brick walls and a small seating area in the style of a private drawing room with many different materials on the walls, on the floor and in the seating arrangement. The reception area is quite small but very welcoming.
This hotel is one of the newest in Amsterdam and is the talk of the town. Formerly a school, it has been lovingly restored to an exceptionally high standard and comes highly recommended. 050908JG

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: The bedrooms are all medium to large and in excellent condition. This hotel offers some of the best accommodation in Amsterdam, with its trendy dark interiors, much attention to detail, and some rooms with beams, some split level and with its immaculately designed bathrooms.

The bedrooms are all medium to large and in excellent condition. This hotel offers some of the best accommodation in Amsterdam, with its trendy dark interiors, much attention to detail, and some rooms with beams, some split level and with its immaculately designed bathrooms.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam, close to the PC Hoofstraat, the most fashionable shopping street in Amsterdam, as well as opposite the Van Gogh and Stedelijk museums. It is around the corner from the Rijks Museum, the Holland Casino, the Vondel Park and the Leidseplein with its cafe and bar culture.
The hotel caters to every taste through a Signature restaurant, Destination Bar, Brasserie and an open-plan Lounge with plush oversized seating.
This is an iconic and traditional building that once housed Amsterdam's premier music conservatorium.

AreaDetails.AreaDetail: 30 kms to the nearest airport (schiphol airport)

Reports.Report: This hotel has a prime location in the centre of Amsterdam, just a 1 minute walk from the Dam Square. It is situated in the heart of the action, so close to shops, restaurants, bars and within a 5 minute walk from the red light district, flower market, canal boat cruises and much, much more.
The bedrooms are fairly basic but functional and in fair condition, as are the bathrooms.
Due to its location, this hotel offers breakfast only and the breakfast room is located on the first floor, accessible only by stairs.
This is a traditional, unassuming building in keeping with the surrounding buildings.
The lobby is large and welcoming with some seating and vending machine. It has floor to ceiling glass frontage offering a great view over the city passing by its doorstep.
This is a basic hotel but with one of the most sought after locations in town. jg/11/2010

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: The bedrooms are fairly basic but functional and in fair condition, as are the bathrooms.

Reports.Report: This modern hotel is located 2 km from Schiphol airport within an industrial site. There is a train station close by for connections to the centre of Amsterdam and a courtesy bus to and from the airport.The hotel is conveniently accessible from the airport via a private airport shuttle bus service. Located only a few miles from the A4, both Amsterdam and The Hague are within easy reach.

All of the large rooms are extremely attractive reflecting the style of the public areas in colour and design dark blues and reds are contrasted with bright splashes of yellow and light wooden furniture. Perhaps their best feature are the huge double beds and exceptional marble bathrooms.
There are 2 Restaurants one which provides international and local cuisine, and the other perfect for lighter meals and snacks. There is also a bar and good leisure facilities.
The hotel is a large, modern building consisting of glass panelling with an impressive entrance.

The spacious lobby is permanently manned by uniformed staff. It is tiled in marble and features both a circular reception desk and spiral staircase. This impressive lobby leads to all public areas which are decorated in deep, warm colours with stylish furniture evoking the feel of tradition, but still maintaining a modern outlook.

The hotel Crowne Plaza Amsterdam Schiphol is a luxury hotel at only a 10-minute drive from Amsterdam Airport Schiphol. This hotel is also the ideal basis to visit the Keukenhof flower bulbs.The hotel Crowne Plaza Amsterdam Schiphol offers a complementary shuttle service to companies in Hoofddorp and the Schiphol area upon request. Hoofddorp train station with direct services to Amsterdam city center and Leiden is only an 8-minute walk.This 242 room hotel features a leisure club with indoor swimming pool, Jacuzzi, gym and solarium for your well-deserved relaxation after a long journey. Looking for a place to meet&reg The hotel Crowne Plaza Amsterdam Schiphol houses 14 multifunctional meeting rooms.The hotel Crowne Plaza Amsterdam Schiphol is very proud to introduce its new stylish restaurant @The Lobby. In a modern yet sophisticated setting you can enjoy fresh culinary delights inspired by Dutch heritage prepared by our renowned chef.High speed Internet access is available at a charge in all guest rooms and public areas.

Reports.Report: Just a short walk from the Central station, this hotel is part of the old quarters of Amsterdam overlooking the main shopping street of the city. Its location is quite busy but very easy to reach due to the fact that many buses and trams stop in front of the building.

The bedrooms are medium to large, but vary slightly in size due to the age of the building. They have recently been completely renovated, as has the entire property, and now offer a more deluxe accommodation with warm colour schemes and all the facilities one would expect from a superior first class hotel.

The restaurant has benefitted from a complete overhaul and is now larger and far more modern. Even the menu has changed to offer more contemporary dishes. The old "Dorrius" in the old style may still be hired out. One of the hotels best features is still its extensive buffet breakfast.
The hotel consists of many old gable houses so it has a traditional exterior, but in contrast the interior is modern.

The lobby area has been completely renovated and now offers a large and airy, contemporary atmosphere. It leads to a very large "living room" with comfortable seating, a fireplace, a library and where drinks may also be served
This is a very good hotel in a perfect location which benefitted from a major renovation in 2009 and now offers classy accommodation in a prime location. jg/07/2010

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the South of Amsterdam, close to the WTC and business district but with easy access to the city centre and Schiphol airport.

This is a brand new product offering modern, and luxurious comfort with all the facilities one would expect from a brand new 4 star hotel. The decor is primarily black and burgundy with leather seating and a 32 inch flat screen television. Their are black and white photos of Geroge Gerswhin on the walls to reflect the street name and ample cupboard space. The bathrooms are in immaculate condition with burgundy tiling and black slate flooring and all rooms have bath

The restaurant is very large and modern in design with an orange and green colourscheme. It serves a sumptuous breakfast buffet and an international a la carte lunch and dinner restaurant and can even cater for small groups requiring a private dining area within the main restaurant as opposed to in a smaller meeting room.
This is a very modern, purpose built hotel
The lobby is large, and modern with ample seating and their is also a bar in the immediate facility which is more dark and cosy and which is open all day for drinks and light snacks.

Reports.Report: This hotel is centrally located within walking distance of the Leidseplein with its bars, restaurants, cinemas and Holland Casino. The Leidsestraat shopping street is also within walking distance. The Vincent van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum are nearby as are all the major attractions this city has to offer.

The bedrooms are medium in size but no two rooms are identical owing to the design of the building. They were all redecorated in 2005 and now have wooden floors and white duvets with attractive covering matching the curtains. The bathrooms were also redecorated and are now in good condition with very attractive, modern green glass sinks and all showers have glass shower screens.
The breakfast room adjoins the reception area. The area is traditionally decorated with artifacts celebrating the hotels name association with the city of Paris.
It has a traditional exterior.

The lobby is part of the reception area and open plan with the breakfast room and bar. The area is kept very traditional Dutch in dark red colors with dark wooden furniture and traditional paintings on the wall.
This is a good, basic, centrally located hotel, suitable for those seeking a prime location. 07/2008/jg

Reports.Report: Located in the centre of Amsterdam, next to the Magna Plaza shopping centre which used to be the old post office, this hotel is perfectly located to see all the main tourist attractions of Amsterdam. It is also within walking distance of central station.
The bedrooms have recently been renovated. All rooms are mainly medium in size and those overlooking the main street are well insulated. As this is an old building, room sizes do tend to vary.
This is located on the ground floor and is very popular with hotel guests and tourists. It serves traditional Dutch cuisine and is renowned for its steaks.
It is a traditional building consisting of numerous old townhouses.
The lobby is small with a small seating area but it is quite welcoming as it has recently been renovated.
A very well located hotel.170908JG

Reports.Report: Located in the very heart of Amsterdam on one of the popular canal streets, this hotel is within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions and can be found just off one of the main shopping streets.

Due to the fact that this is an old building, all the rooms vary in size; however, they are all medium to large and all decorated to a high standard having recently benefited from renovation. Some rooms have beamed ceilings, some have views on the canal and all have traditional furniture. Most of the bathrooms have been renovated and these are also in very good condition, as are the bathrooms that have not been renovated, although the new bathrooms are very modern in style with tiled floors, granite sinks and heated towel rails.

The breakfast room is located on the lower ground floor and is a large and beautiful old room with stained glass windows. There is a restaurant but the hotel does not run this; it is on the lower ground floor of the hotel although there is a separate entrance on the canal side of the property. This is quite a formal restaurant serving International cuisine, but it is not the original Dikker and thisrestaurant is not the one that the hotel used to be famous for.
This is a traditional building in keeping with the surrounding buildings found on many of the canal streets.
The lobby is small and bright with limited seating.
This is an excellent hotel with a prime location right in the heart of Amsterdam and is ideal for those seeking a typical Dutch experience. jg/09/09/08

Most of the bathrooms have been renovated and these are also in very good condition, as are the bathrooms that have not been renovated, although the new bathrooms are very modern in style with tiled floors, granite sinks and heated towel rails.

Reports.Report: This property is not only one of Amsterdam's oldest hotels, but is also situated in the same building where Rembrandt produced his famous painting "The Nightwatch". The hotel overlooks one of the city's most charming canals and even has its own docking point for tour boats. It was originally built in 1530 as a soldiers lookout post, hence the famous Rembrandt painting.
The medium sized bedrooms are in good condition. They feature a predominantly red and yellow colour scheme evoking a Laura Ashley style room; being very cosy and elegant at the same time.

This hotel serves breakfast only and the breakfast room has delightful views over the Amstel River. There is also a small bar located next to the lobby and in the hotels former restaurant, there is now a Coffee Company which serves coffee, cakes and other light snacks in a friendly atmosphere, also overlooking the Amstel River.

This traditional, old building is quite noticeable from the opposite side of the canal as it still retains many of its original features, most noticeably the watchmen from where Rembrandt got his inspiration.
The lobby is very traditional with marble flooring and antique ornaments, although it is quite small.
This hotel has a perfect location and is a brilliant hotel for individuals wishing to experience a little Dutch history and for smaller groups. 080908JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the heart of the city overlooking the famous river Amstel, and opposite the opera house of Amsterdam 'De Stopera.' There is also easy access to the famous Rembrandt Plein with its terraces and shops as well as to all the major tourist attractions that this famous city has to offer.

The hotel has recently been renovated and now offers lovely, modern rooms, although these differ very much in size due to the fact that the hotel consists of numerous old Amsterdam houses. The bedrooms and bathrooms are in very good conditin.
This is situated off the lobby and is a large area offering ample seating for families and individuals. It is very open plan and modern and serves an extensive hot buffet breakfast.
The hotel was constructed from typical Dutch townhouses, therefore its facade is very traditional.

The hotel has a large lobby which has recently been renovated and which offers plenty of seating and is very welcoming. It is a very busy city centre hotel with lots of hustle and bustle and the lobby is great for people watching. There is now a coffee bar area which not only serves coffee but also small snacks, and the bar has also been renovated and offers a serene atmosphere for drinks both day and night.
This is an excellent hotel in a prime location and is suitable for both groups and individuals from all markets. 09/10/2009/jg

Reports.Report: This hotel has a prime location in the heart of Amsterdam, on the Rembrandtsplein, overlooking the Waterlooplein and its famous market, and within walking distance of the Flower Market, Red Light District, Central Station, Kalverstraat (Amsterdams no 1 shopping street) and nearly all other tourist attractions.

The bedrooms are in very good condition as the hotel only opened in 2006. They are modern with a dark grey interior and are a decent size. The bathrooms are also in very good condition and offer pristine showers in a good sized bathroom.

The hotel has a breakfast room located on the ground floor and for lunch and dinner, guests and non-residents alike can eat at the renowned Cafe Flo which serves a local and French cusine, specialising in shellfish and meats.
This is a modern, purpose built hotel which also fits in very well with its surroundings.
The lobby is very large with ample seating but no real redemming features as the hotels bar and lounge are located in a different part of the hotel.
This is a nice hotel in an excellent location offering good accommodation and a renowned restaurant. 10/2009/jg

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: The bedrooms are in very good condition as the hotel only opened in 2006. They are modern with a dark grey interior and are a decent size. The bathrooms are also in very good condition and offer pristine showers in a good sized bathroom.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to the city centre in a slightly quieter district.
The bedrooms are all medium in size and decorated in a style that is very much in keeping with the rest of the hotel which is traditional. The bedrooms and bathrooms are in very good condition.
The restaurant serves a primarily Italian cuisine, as well as a grand breakfast buffet.
This is a traditional building and gives a very good first impression. It easily stands out against the rest of the buildings in the vicinity.
The lobby is attractive and welcoming with comfortable seating.
This is a well awaited for addition to Amsterdam and offers first class accommodation in a perfect location and comes highly recommended. jg/12/2010

Reports.Report: Located in the very centre of town overlooking one of Amsterdams beautiful canals, this deluxe hotel is within walking distance of Central station, is also in the heart of the shopping district, close to the flower market and to all major tourist attractions.

All bedrooms are medium sized and are all very unique and as is expected from a hotel of this standard, all are in very good condition as they are continuously being checked and refurbished as and when required. As this hotel is very traditional, all rooms come complete with antiques in the rooms which themselves are of course very luxurious. The bathrooms are also in good condition and traditional in style.

The hotel has had a major total renovation which was completed in 2011 and now offers several food and beverage outlets including the Hoofdstaat Brasserie serving french bistrot food with an open kitchen and offering 700 different wines as well as small wine tasting tours. A luxurious and extensive breakfast is also served in this restaurant which offers wonderful views over the river Amstel. The Restaurant Bordeau is the gastronomic restaurant offering mouthwatering French cuisine with a Dutch twist and localised produces. It also benefits from extensive canal views and has outdoor seating, weather permitting. Freddies Bar is the original bar that Freddy Heineken, the founder of Heineken and owners of the hotel, loved to frequent. it is a very cosy, traditional bar and also offers a seperate smoking/cigar room.

A beautiful, traditional building with the kitchen of the famous restaurant at water level so that during a canal cruise, the kitchen is included in all canal cruises "places of interest" due to its worldwide reputation.

Completely renovated in 2011 the lobby has the wow factor with its scarlett walls, copies of 6 Dutch master paintings (the originals may be seen in the Rijksmusuem) adorning the walls and Morano glass chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. This room also incorporates the lobby lounge and bar which offers drinks and light snacks and specialises in afternoon tea and of course the reception area.
This is one of the most famous hotels in Amsterdam and offers luxury and elegance throughout with a perfect location in the centre of Amsterdam, on one of the cities famous canals. 040908JG

The rooms are mainly medium sized, although there are some smaller rooms due to the shape of the building. They are predominantly green and red/pink in decor and with wood furniture including a writing desk and they are in good condition, although they would benefit from a bit of updating.
The hotel serves breakfast only on the ground floor in a pretty non-descript breakfast room.
The exterior of the building is traditional with a small, brightly lit entrance.
The lobby is small with dark wood paneling and a small reception area.

Reports.Report: This hotel has a lovely location in the heart of the city, on a small side street off the Overtoom. It is adjacent to the Vondel park and has many bars, restaurants and shops on its doorstep. It is also within walking distance of the Leidseplein, with its bars and restaurants and famous Holland Casino, the u shopping street of the PC Hoofsstraat, and the Van Gogh and Rijks Museum. It is a short tram ride away from Central Station - approx 12 mins by tram.

The bedrooms are all very different and unique and offer some of the best accommodation of any 3 star hotel in Amsterdam. They are all influenced by various philosophers, hence the hotels name. An example is one room decorated with antiques, chandeliers and quotes painted on the walls, or the Asian style Confucius room decorated in purple and silver. All rooms are in very good condition and are very tastefully decorated with much attention to detail. The bathrooms are also in very good condition but consist mainly of showers only.

The hotel serves breakfast only due to its prime location. The breakfast room is located on the lower ground floor and is tastefully decorated with a black and gold colour scheme; however, breakfast may also be taken in the beautiful lounge that leads off the lobby and which is decorated in a royal red colour, with fresh flowers, chandeliers and even a red and gold reading area. There is also a lovely conservatory where breakfast may be taken, as well as in the exquisite, large garden.
This is a lovely, traditional building, in keeping with its surrounds.
The lobby is medium sized and welcoming and also incorporates a small bar area. The lobby leads straight into the lounge area.
This is an excellent find in a quiet but central location, ideal for all travelers, and comes very highly recommended. It is a jewel in Amsterdams crown. 220808KC

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam, close to Central Station and at the edge of the Red Light District. It is within easy access of the main shopping district of Amsterdam and a short tram ride to the majority of museums which are located on the Museumplein.

The bedrooms are small and basic though recently refurbished with wood floors and wood furniture. They are in good condition as are the bathrooms and all have individual air conditioning. The bathrooms are basic with white tiling and some have shower only and some have bath and shower although these room types cannot be guaranteed.

The breakfast room is located in the Irish pub directly next to the hotel. It is a popular and cosy eating establishment and serves a hearty breakfast. In the summer, there is seating along the canal.
This is a traditional building in keeping with the buildings in the area and are typical Dutch style.

The lobby is medium-sized and was also renovated in 2006. It now benefits from a trendy feel, with brown carpeting, gold velour seating and modern lighting. There are also futuristic stools and tables offering an updated and vastly improved atmosphere. The lobby is split level and there are steps up to the reception area which may not be ideal for people with walking difficulties.

This hotel is in a prime location in the centre of Amsterdam and suitable for those who are looking to be close to the red light district and China town, one of the busier areas of Amsterdam. However, it is located on a small side street opposite a canal and so is quieter than most of the streets in the area. jg/05/2007

Reports.Report: Just minutes from the heart of Amsterdam, this hotel is located in one of the loveliest districts of the city which offers numerous bars and restaurants, boutique and designer shops, and is still within walking distance to the world-famous Rijksmuseum and Museumplein. It is also located close to the beautiful Vondel Park where you can rollerblade, go jogging, or just sit in one of the many cafes and watch the world go by.

All bedrooms were renovated in 2006 and are now all decorated to a very high standard with a beige and earthy colour scheme, yet keeping the cosy atmosphere that penetrates the entire hotel. The bathrooms have also been renovated and both bedrooms and bathrooms are in very good condition.

There is an excellent restaurant renowned for its haute cuisine which is located on the ground floor and serves exquisite food with first class service. Dishes are International but with a French influence.
The exterior is a modern low-rise building with the main entrance on a residential street. The restaurant with its glass windows is the first sight upon approaching the hotel.

The lobby is very welcoming and was also totally renovated in 2006. The colour scheme is, like the bedrooms, predominantly earthy and retains its elegance and style and feature fireplace. The bar is also located off the lobby and has been completely modernized as has the reception area.
This is a lovely hotel in a tranquil setting close to the heart of Amsterdam and comes highly recommended. It also offers wireless LAN throughout the hotel. 120907JG

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: All bedrooms were renovated in 2006 and are now all decorated to a very high standard with a beige and earthy colour scheme, yet keeping the cosy atmosphere that penetrates the entire hotel. The bathrooms have also been renovated and both bedrooms and bathrooms are in very good condition.

Reports.Report: This hotel is situated in the oldest part of Amsterdam in the very heart of the city, overlooking Central station, a few minutes away from the main entertainment and shopping area, as well as the financial district.

Many of the rooms are located in the restored 17th and 18th century part of the hotel with its original oak beams and rafters. They vary quite a lot in shape and size due to the age of the building, but are on average medium to large. They are decorated in typical Dutch style with dark wooden furniture, cosy armchairs and contrasting patterned fabrics and furnishings. Bathrooms are on the whole of medium size and modern.

The hotel has a Michelin restaurant called ”Vermeer” which serves a la carte food in formal but relaxed surroundings. There is also a Dutch 'brown cafe' in typical local style, and an elegant cocktail lounge with original fireplaces. There is also the Hudson which serves food all day and is located in the lobby and where breakfast is served. The hotel bar has recently been renovated and is now very modern with modern seating, lighting, and relaxing music and serves cocktails as well as beer, wine etc.
The building itself has been partly built from the facades of 19th historic buildings, most of which date from the 17th century.

The large lobby has recently been renovated and now benefits from a black and orange colour scheme with ample luxurious seating and intimate lighting. The restaurant’s cafe is also located in a part of the lobby.
This is a very nice deluxe hotel with a very central location and which comes highly recommended. 081107JG

Reports.Report: Located in the city centre, this hotel overlooks the famous Leidse Square and one of the many canals of Amsterdam. It is also situated very close to the Rijks Museum, the Holland Casino, the Vondel Park, PC Hooftstraat, the most fashionable shopping street of Amsterdam, as well as the majority of tourist attractions.

The bedrooms were completely renovated in 2004 and now offer a vastly improved product. All rooms have an attractive dark wooden floor with dark wooden fittings and earthy beige and cream colour scheme and soft furnishings. As they have only recently been renovated, they are all in very good condition. The bathrooms are also newly renovated with beige floor and wood tiles and are also in very good condition.

There are two restaurants on this property. The Italian restaurant ”Bice” is very popular with local businessmen and overlooks the Leidseplein, and the new bistro lounge, which is located in the newly renovated lobby, serves light snacks as well as more hearty fare in a trendy and relaxed atmosphere.
The exterior of the hotel is modern.

The lobby was completely renovated in 2005 and offers a typical NH atmosphere with a predominantly black and orange colour scheme, wood floors, plenty of space and areas to sit, as well as the lounge bar mentioned above. It is both welcoming and luxurious at the same time.

This hotel has been completely renovated and is the first NH hotel in Holland to benefit from total renovation. It is now very worthy of its 5 star classification and, with its perfect location, it is ideal for all markets and comes highly recommended. 081107JG

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: The bedrooms were completely renovated in 2004 and now offer a vastly improved product. All rooms have an attractive dark wooden floor with dark wooden fittings and earthy beige and cream colour scheme and soft furnishings. As they have only recently been renovated, they are all in very good condition. The bathrooms are also newly renovated with beige floor and wood tiles and are also in very good condition.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to the centre of Amsterdam, at the top of the Overtoom, with its trendy bars and cafes. A 25 minute walk will bring you to the Leidseplein and a tram takes 5 minutes. The hotel is also within walking distance from the lovely Vondel Park and is also within easy access to Schiphol airport, with trams and train stations practically on its doorstep
The bedrooms are medium in size and are very comfortable and luxurious and offer all the facillties one would expect from a relatively new 4 star hotel. The bathrooms are also in very good condition.

The restaurant is located on the ground floor and also benefits from a lovely terrace. It is decorated in a baroquial style and serves all meals. The hotel also has a wonderful roof top bar that also serves snacks.
This is a modern, purpose built block
The lobby is large and has ample seating and also leads to the terrace and the bar area, which is decorated in baroquial style. It is very large and airy and welcoming.

This hotel has been a very welcome addition to Amsterdam with its star attractions being its indoor pool area and rooftop bar. Without doubt one of the finest 4 star properties Amsterdam has to offer. jg/07/2010

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the old part of Amsterdam overlooking one of the cities most charming canals and is just a short walk from the Central Station, Dam Square and the Red Light district, as well as the main shopping street called the Kalverstraat. It is a former 16th century Royal Inn and was the setting for the wedding of Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands.

The entire hotel has undergone a major refurbishment and the new bedrooms are far more contemporary than before with a mainly purple colour scheme, flat screen tv with bose sound system, a small writing desk and large walk-in rain showers in the bathroom. They are very luxurious and no expense has been spared which means that they offer some of the best accommodation in town.

Bridges restaurant has become one of the best known restaurants in Amsterdam since its opening in 2010. It specialises in fish but offers first class meat and fish dishes and has appeared in numerous magazines and tv shows including "Top Chef". It also has a beautiful summer terrace and a raw fish bar. A sumptuous breakfast is also served in this elegant and modern room overlooking the garden and also the street and canal.
The hotel has retained its historical features and has one of the most impressive entrances in Amsterdam with a welcoming courtyard offering peace and tranquility, in the heart of the city centre.

The lobby was recently completely renovated, along with the rest of the hotel, and offers a more contemporary feel with a grand reception area and feature lighting, a cosy and intimate bar/lounge area and doors leading to its oasis of a garden where guests can have lunch, dinner or a drink

Following its renovations, and with its excellent attention to detail, service,its first class restaurant and prime location, this is without doubt one of the top 3 hotels in Amsterdam and comes highly recommended

The rooms are medium to large in size and were completely renovated in 2008. They are now very modern, approx 35 square metres in size, and all have opulent furniture with either a dark purple or green colour theme. They all benefit from flat screen tv's and a bose sound system and are in excellent condition. The bathrooms are also in excellent condition and have seperate showers and bath with a built-in tv at one end of the bath, and with dark slate floor.The rooms vary in size and shape as they have been individually designed to reflect the building's historic past. They have views onto the 17th century canals, the secluded garden or the paved inner courtyard.

Reports.Report: Located in a suburb of Amsterdam and only 10 mins from Schiphol airport, this hotel is surrounded by green spaces and gives easy access to Amsterdam and the rest of Holland. It is also located right next door to the sport and party centre "De Kegel" which offers many recreational facilities.

All the bedrooms are large in size and are decorated in beechwood red. They are very spacious and in very good condition. All the bathrooms have a separate bath and shower and are in pristine condition with two double sinks in black finish, a white floor and wall tiles, and a separate toilet.

Located on the ground floor, this is where breakfast is served. The buffet is in the centre of the room and the decor is slightly dated with florals and pale green wicker chairs. Located across from the hotel, 500m away in the party centre there are numerous restaurants where one can have lunch or dinner in a cosy, typically Dutch atmosphere and where one can also have a gastronomic meal.
The building is a low rise, modern style block without any distinguishing features.

The medium sized lobby is more stylish with marble flooring, large plants, and an unusual chandelier. There is also a balcony on the first floor which overlooks this area. The reception desk is situated to the right hand side and leads to a cosy corner with sofas and coffee tables, as well as to other public areas.

This hotel is suitable for all types of travelers although some may find it hard to get around if they do not have their own transport. However, for group business, this hotel definitely offers value.. 01/07/08jg

All the bathrooms have a separate bath and shower and are in pristine condition with two double sinks in black finish, a white floor and wall tiles, and a separate toilet.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to the centre of Amsterdam and just off the highway A10 which has good connections by car to the airport it is reachable within 20 minutes - and to the city centre with tram #2 which takes you to the centre of town within 10 minutes. There is also a shuttle bus to the airport from this hotel but it is not free of charge.

The rooms vary in size from medium to large and as of 01 August 2007 have all been renovated. They are modern in design with dark brown furniture with red cushions, and red bed slips and are in very good condition and of a very high standard for a 3 star hotel. The renovated bathrooms also have dark brown wood surrounding modern silver sinks and some bathrooms have glass brick showers, all of which are in very good condition and a great improvement, making it some of the nicest 3 star rooms in Amsterdam.

There is a very large restaurant which was also renovated in 2007 and offers a more modern outlook. This is located on the ground floor and currently serves a large hot buffet breakfast only although adjacent to this is a bar area offering drinks and a pool table. In the modernized hotel lobby there is a small cafe serving light snacks and, weather permitting, guests can sit in the small garden at the front of the hotel.
This is a modern, building with no special features.

The lobby is large with ample seating and with a lovely, welcoming terrace where, in the summer months, guests can have a bite to eat or a drink. It was also given a facelift in 2007 and offers a more modern look with modern and welcoming seating and a much more attractive entrance.
This is a good property located in a quieter part of Amsterdam but still within easy reach of all tourist attractions, Central Station, and the airport, and it comes highly recommended. 07/2008/JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is ideally located on one of the most beautiful canals in Amsterdam, in one of the most sought after areas with its trendy boutiques and restaurants. It is also within walking distance of the Museumplein and Leidseplein and is also only 5 minutes by tram from the Leidseplein and 15 minutes by tram to Central Station. Numerous trams are available from near the hotel.

The medium sized bedrooms are typical Hilton style with two double beds in each twin room. All the rooms were renovated in 2001 with modern furnishings in Italian style and strong, contrasting colours. The white tiled bathrooms are also in very good condition and the rooms offer all the facilities and the high standards that one would expect from a 5 star Hilton hotel.

The Italian restaurant has a deservably excellent reputation, and the tiramisu is especially recommended. There is also a cosy British bar which is situated at the back of the hotel overlooking the garden and canal which is very popular with locals as well as residents with its open fireplace and commanding views of the canal, and which serves bar snacks.
The hotel is an imposing, large, modern style purpose-built block.

The lobby area is large and very modern and decorated in Italian style with marble flooring and fashionable furniture and works of art. It exudes luxury and is a very impressive hotel lobby, with a boutique and Italian coffee shop also located here.

This is an excellent hotel in a lovely location, not right in the heart of Amsterdam but on one of the most beautiful canals and in one of the most prestigious parts of town, and still within walking distance of most tourist attractions. The service level in this hotel is also second to none. 12/08/08 KC

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the south part of Amsterdam, within walking distance of the Museumplein, Leidseplein, the Vondel Park and is in a lovely, picturesque area.
The hotel has benefitted from a major renovation and now offers 4 star accommodation with new beds and furnishings, lcd televisions, and along with the bathrooms are in excellent condition.

The breakfast room is located on the lower ground floor in a light and airy ambience benefitting from large windows with its views over the treelined street that the hotel backs on to. Their is also a bar offering snacks on the first floor with a terrace that again, offers views of the tree lined residential street where the hotel is located.
This is a traditional building in a street with similar, attractive buildings.
The lobby is medium in size and has benefitted from a major overhaul with its "trendy" swing chair, booth style seating and modern lounging atmosphere.

This is now an excellent property with 4 star accommodation and facilities in a beautiful, quiet part of Amsterdam yet only a 5 minute tram ride or 20 minute walk to the heart of the city. With the numerous shops, restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity, this property comes highly recommended. jg/07/2010

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the quiet part of the well-known P.C.Hoofstraat, where the best fashion houses are based. The hotel joins onto the Vondelpark and the historical city centre. The Leidseplein and countless restaurants and bars are all within walking distance, as are the famous museums.

The rooms are medium to large in size and while basic they contain all the necessary facilities. They have a varied colour scheme, which is predominantly blue/brown with Formica furniture, but could benefit from redecoration. The bathrooms are in good condition with grey tiling.
There is only a breakfast room in this hotel but it is bright and airy with pink decor and in the summer one can eat on the terrace.
A traditional building dating back to the last century.
The lobby is small but welcoming a little dated and extends to a bar, which is currently only open on weekends from 5 pm.
This is a good, centrally located property.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to the busy ”Rai” congress centre and a short ride from the city centre via the metro, train, or tram which are all located close by, making this hotel easily accessible from the centre of town as well as the airport.

All bedrooms have air conditioning and about 50% have 2 queen size beds and the rest have 1 king size bed. The colour scheme is predominantly blue, yellow and pink and all rooms are medium sized although some are larger than others.

The restaurant is located on the first floor and has been completely refurbished, along with the bar, in a very attractive New England theme with wood floors, tartan furniture and mementos from Vermont. The restaurant serves a New England menu.
The hotel has a modern exterior, but does not reflect the style and quality of the interior.
The medium sized lobby has a slate tile floor and a small seating area consisting of leather chesterfield armchairs next to a small fountain. A new addition is the Internet area.
This is a good quality hotel for all travelers. 100807JG

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: All bedrooms have air conditioning and about 50% have 2 queen size beds and the rest have 1 king size bed. The colour scheme is predominantly blue, yellow and pink and all rooms are medium sized although some are larger than others.
