AreaDetails.AreaDetail: 15 kms to the nearest airport (schiphol airport)

Reports.Report: This hotel has an excellent location right in the middle of the red light district in the centre of Amsterdam. It is also a stone's throw from Central Station and is within walking distance of most tourist attractions, bars, restaurants and shops.

The bedrooms are in very good condition and are of a decent standard decorated in a lovely silver, cream and black colour scheme. They offer tea and coffee facilities and all benefit from flatscreen televisions. The bathrooms are also very nice with a grey and white colour scheme and most rooms have a double shower head!! The bedrooms and bathrooms vary in shape and size due to the nature of the building and so range from small and cosy to medium

This hotel does not have a restaurant and does not currently serve breakfast, however, there is a cold corner where sandwiches and yogurts may be purchased and their is a very large seating area on the lower ground floor where food may be consumed and which has lovely views over the canals.
The exterior is a traditional building that has benefitted from a facelift consisting of a clean and new paint. It is a very white building that stands out from the other buildings in the street.
The lobby is quite small but incorporates a cold corner where small food items may be purchased, and this leads down to the lower ground eating area.
This is a very good 3 star hotel in an ideal location and comes highly recommended. jg/03/2010

RoomCategory.RoomDescription: The bedrooms are in very good condition and are of a decent standard decorated in a lovely silver, cream and black colour scheme. They offer tea and coffee facilities and all benefit from flatscreen televisions. The bathrooms are also very nice with a grey and white colour scheme and most rooms have a double shower head!! The bedrooms and bathrooms vary in shape and size due to the nature of the building and so range from small and cosy to medium

AreaDetails.AreaDetail: 14 kms to the nearest airport (schiphol airport)

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the very heart of Amsterdam, just around the corner from the Museumplein and the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum and also opposite the PC Hoofstraat with its designer shops and cafes. It is also a small stroll from the Leidseplein with all its shops, cafes and the famous Holland Museum, and also from the Vondel Park

The bedrooms are very well maintained and cotemporary in design offering all the facilities expected of a hotel of its class including Cocomat beds, LCD televisions in the bedroom AND bathroom, a dvd player in all rooms and exceptionally large cupboard space. The bathrooms are in excellent condition with fantastic power showers and dark grey slate floors with the added benefit that the sink is located in the bedroom and not the bathroom offering increased space and the ability to use the sink and mirror when someone else is using the bathroom.
The restaurant is incorporated into the bar and lounge area and is very warm and welcoming. A delcious hot bufet breakfast is served and there is also a lunch and dinner menu available
Although this is a brand new product that opened in the summer of 2011, it is a traditional building with a traditional exterior

The lobby is medium in size but very bright and includes the reception area, an honesty bar where guests sign for the drinks that they consume, an internet corner as well as the restaurant which also overlooks the lovely small back garden with its decking and seating in the summer, weather permitting!

This is an excellent new addition to the city centre of Amsterdam with a fantastic location in an exclusive part of town yet a short walk to all major attractions. It comes highly recommended jg July 2011

Reports.Report: This new property has an excellent location on the Overtoom which is a 2 minute walk from the popular Leidseplein with its bars, restaurants, nightlife and casino. Their are many restaurants on the hotels doorstep and the world famous Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are just around the corner, as is the fabulous Vondel Park
The bedrooms are medium in size but extremely comfortable offering a modern decor, flat screen televisions and free wifi. The modern bathrooms have shower only and are in very good condition
Their is only a coffe corner and breakfast room in this property as it is so well located for the numerous restaurants that may be found on its doorstep.
This is a traditional building but the hotel is newly opened in 2012
A warm and welcoming lobby incorporating a comfortable coffee corner
This hotel has one of the best locations in town and as the newest 3 star to open its doors (March 2012) comes highly recommended

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam, right next to Central Station. This makes it an ideal location to explore not only the sights and sounds of Amsterdam, but also the rest of Holland. It is a short walk from the red light district, the flower market, Dam Square and the Jordaan district, and only a short tram ride away from the Museumplein where you can find the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum.
Typical of the new Ibis rooms, the bedrooms are small and basic but clean and very comfortable. Bathrooms are shower only but are also clean and comfortable and both are in very good condition.

The entire hotel is being extended and benefitting from renovations in 2008 and while the restaurant was not yet open at time of writing this report, it will be very large and modern and will offer a brasserie type menu.
The exterior of the hotel is very modern and when the additional hotel wing is completed, it will wrap over the train tracks!
Again, the lobby is currently being completely renovated, however, when it is open, it will be very large and modern and will lead to a large and modern seating area and restaurant.
This is a great hotel to have in our portfolio, in a very central location and offers very good service and value for money. jg/05/2008

Reports.Report: Located in the centre of Amsterdam, close to the Waterlooplein and a short walk from Central Station.

The bedrooms are medium in size but are larger than the majority of the rooms in Ibis properties in Benelux. They are in very good condition and have recently benefitted from a make over where the colour scheme is a more attractive cream and beige, with wooden flooring and LCD televisions, along with a media hub in all rooms. The bathrooms are also in good condition and although with shower only, the showers are large with glass doors and are generally quite modern and attractive.
Located on the ground floor, behind the bar area, the restaurant is also attractive with modern flooring and there is a garden with a deck where people can have breakfast.
A modern, purpose-built hotel.

The lobby was renovated in 2009 and is large and spacious with marble floor, limited seating and leads to the large bar area which has also been renovated in an attractive dark wood and red colour scheme and which offers ample seatin and a small bar menu.
A good Ibis hotel with a good location. jg/03/2009

Reports.Report: This hotel is located within easy access to the centre of Amsterdam and can be reached by metro (Isolatorweg) or by bus #48 which stops directly outside the hotel.

The bedrooms are in very good condition as the hotel opened in 2004 and they are typical of the new style Ibis hotels with terra-cotta and green colour schemes. The rooms are medium-sized and all have individual air conditioning. The bathrooms are still sparkling clean with large showers only and a green, faux marble sink and wooden flooring and are thus in excellent condition.

This is located on the ground floor and is incorporated into the bar and serves lunch and dinner and snacks. It will soon be re-located to the first floor once the extension is finished, but, for now, the breakfast room is found on the first floor and can be reached by a open plan staircase leading from the reception/bar area.
This is a very modern, purposefully built hotel.

The lobby is large as it incorporates the bar and dining area which is comfortable and attractive with a modern décor and aterra cotta and yellow colour scheme which gives it a warm,cosy, and welcoming atmosphere. The reception desk is located directly opposite the entrance of the lobby.

This is a very nice product, with the bedrooms typical of Ibis but the public areas are of a higher standard than one may usually expect from an Ibis. An airport shuttle bus stops directly outside the hotel but this is not free of charge. This property is ideal for groups and individuals. 040108JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam, within walking distance of Central Station, Dam Square, the shopping district and all major tourist attractions.
The bedrooms vary in size as the hotel consists of many existing townhouses, but all bedrooms are medium sized and in good condition. The bathrooms are also in good condition.

The restaurant is located on the 1st floor of the hotel. It serves breakfast only but offers group meals upon request. It has a special deal with the restaurant next door for individual meals. It is a large and bright room.
A very modern and distinctive building with a glass frontage.

The lobby area is large, modern and sparse. Beyond the reception desk there is a very attractive seating area with a large wooden table where one can read the newspapers (this is a very Dutch activity), as well as regular sofas and a very cosy fireplace.
A good hotel and with an ideal, central location. jg12/2006

The upmarket PC Hoofsstraat is nearby with its deluxe boutiques, such as Cartier, Louis Vuitton etc. as well as numerous fashionable restaurants and bars so the location of this property is really a first class location.

The bedrooms are basic but have all offer bright, good value for accommodation. The rooms are medium sized and in good condition, as are the bathrooms although family rooms i.e. those with extra beds appear quite small. Triples and Quad rooms are with bunk beds.

Reports.Report: The hotel enjoys an ideal location in the centre of Amsterdam, close to the exclusive shopping street, PC Hoofstraat, and close to the museums and the famous Leidseplein with its Holland Casino.

The bedrooms are predominantly medium in size and most have recently been renovated and are coloured in earthy colours and offer deluxe accommodation and are in very good condition. The bathrooms are also in very good condition.
Due to its location, the hotel does not have a restaurant and only serves breakfast. The breakfast room is small but cosy.
This is a traditional building, in keeping with the other buildings in this residential street.
The lobby is small and intimate with a marble floor and antiques. It leads to a small, cosy lounge bar area where one can have a drink or a light snack.
The location of this hotel is ideal for those wishing to stay in the centre of Amsterdam. This is the perfect hotel for individuals and small groups. 120907JG

Reports.Report: Located in a prime position overlooking the flower market and in the heart of the busy town centre. Within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions as well as the main shopping district and the Rembrandtsplein.

The bedrooms vary a lot in size, but are on average small to medium. They are all decorated in the same pleasant modern style with shades of blue and light wooden furniture. The white tiled bathrooms are also small to average in size and in good condition.

The hotel has a cafe/bar overlooking the flower market offering a modest a la carte menu. There is also an excellent Italian restaurant on the first floor which is rather grand but authentically decorated.
The building itself is very old, but has been restored to its former glory. Its typical Dutch style exterior blends in well with the neighboring buildings.
The lobby and public areas are attractively decorated in Italian style using lots of marble and with minimal seating.
The hotel offers a good standard of comfort and enjoys one of the best locations in town.

Reports.Report: Located in the city centre in the heart of Amsterdam, overlooking the famous National Monument on the Dam Square and within walking distance from the Central station and the well-known 'red light district.'

The standard rooms are located in the main building and are medium to large in size. They are modern in style with traditional touches, and along with the bathrooms are in very good condition. The business rooms, which are located in the court wing, are decorated with dark furnishings and fabrics whereas the executive rooms in the royal wing are very modern with marble effect bathrooms.

This is very grand and elegant with a high glass ceiling and surrounding palm trees. Both breakfast and lunch are served here. There is also a Japanese restaurant which is a gastronomic restaurant decorated in rich gold colours.
This is a traditional hotel with large red and white awnings which consist of 3 separate buildings.
The large lobby is shared between the main building and the conference centers and is beautifully decorated in traditional style with chandeliers, easy chairs, dining/coffee tables and sofas.
This is a grand hotel with a lot of history located on the Dam square, the heart of Amsterdam. 080908JG

Reports.Report: The Lancaster hotel is located in a residential area opposite the zoo (Artis) and is only a short tram ride away from Central station, 4 stops from the Rembrandtsplein by tram, and is surrounded by trendy bars and restaurants. It is also within easy access to all the main attractions of the city.

All the bedrooms offer accommodation with a relaxing beige and terracotta colour scheme, a desk in all bedrooms with an attractive leather chair and references throughout the bedrooms and hotel to the city of Amsterdam and its history. The bedrooms are in very good condition, as are the bathrooms, which have not been renovated but which are simply decorated with white tiling and are kept sparkling clean.

Due to the central location of this hotel, it serves breakfast only and the breakfast room may be found on the lower ground floor. It benefits from a lovely wooden floor, purple lighting, red chairs and many Dutch artefacts, giving it a bright and cheerful atmosphere.
The exterior of the building is traditional whereas the interior is more modern in appearance.

Medium sized with a very modern outlook with a circular steel and wooden reception desk. It is split level with a large, communal central wooden table with attractive leather chairs, vending machines and a free internet corner. An attractive chandelier and intimate lighting all give the lobby a cosy feel.
This hotel has a pretty location in Amsterdam and is suitable for all travellers. 10/2009

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam, close to the Jordaan area and just off one of the beautiful canals for which Amsterdam is famous. It is within walking distance of the Leidseplein with its Holland Casino, close to the Museum Plein, home to the world renowned Van Gogh and Rijks Museums and is within walking distance of all touristic and shopping attractions.
The rooms are medium in size and in good condition with flat screen televisions and attractive bedding. They are fairly basic but clean and functional.
The breakfast room is located on the ground floor and is bright and airy. Due to its location, only breakfast is served here.
This is a traditional building in keeping with the residential area it is in.
The lobby is small and welcoming and leads to the breakfast room.
This is a lovey and welcome hotel to our portfolio with a location that cannot be beat. jg/09/2009

Reports.Report: This hotel is centrally located on the outskirts of the red light district and it is within a two minutewalk from Central Station, amidst the renowned bars and coffee shops of Amsterdam.

The bedrooms are all in very good condition as this hotel only opened in July 2002 and all of them have air conditioning. All the bedroom furniture is from Italy as one of the owners is Italian and the bedrooms are all medium sized with light wood and burgundy colours - again, of a very high standard for this kind of product, especially with this location. The bathrooms are also in good condition.

The hotel offers breakfast only and the breakfast area is in the bar and also behind the bar which is partitioned by a particularly attractive fake wooden book case showing that the hotel gives much attention to detail.
Although surrounded by traditional buildings, this hotel was completely knocked down before it was reconstructed in 2002 therefore the building is modern but in traditional surroundings.

The lobby is small and includes a bar but is decorated very nicely and a little eccentrically with dark red walls and dark brown furniture and attractive, ornate gilt mirrors. It is very welcoming and of a very high standard for this kind of product in the heart of Amsterdam.
This is an excellent product in the heart of the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam and is probably the best product of its category in this area. 020807JG

Reports.Report: This small hotel is located within walking distance of the Concertgebouw and the Museumplein but is in a tranquil area, a short walk from trendy restaurants, bars and shops.

Most rooms are medium sized and attractively decorated in the same English style as the rest of the hotel although they are quite dated and could benefit from some renovation work. The bathrooms are in good condition.

There is not a restaurant, but there is the possibility of having a daily menu on request in the evenings. The bar is quite large with differing styles of furniture which are from Italy and give the hotel a modern slant.
The exterior of the building has recently been cleaned and has been kept in the traditional style of the area.
The inviting lobby has also benefited from the introduction of Italian furniture which gives it a modern look that is in complete contrast to the style of the bedrooms and is warm and welcoming.

This hotel is in a prime location, away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre but still within walking distance. There is also a tram stop around the corner to the hotel which would get you to Central Station in less than 15 minutes, passing through the heart of the city. 09/11 010708JG

The bedrooms are of a good standard, decorated in modern style with traditional touches including rocking chairs. All the modern bathrooms are also in good condition, and have shower only.
It used to be the premises of the weavers guild, hence its historic appearance, and in the 60's was converted into a hotel.
The entrance is via a cobbled courtyard and the small lobby is in traditional style with old beams and alcoves.

Refurbished in April 2008, the charming Hotel Mercure Amsterdam Arthur Frommer is entirely non-smoking. The hotel has over 93 tastefully designed rooms and bathrooms, a bar, a breakfast room and a limited number of private parking spaces available for a fee.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located along the A2 Utrecht-Amsterdam motorway and the A10 ring road. It is close to the Rai conference centre, the World Trade Centre and is between Schiphol airport and the heart of Amsterdam.

All the medium sized bedrooms are double glazed and air conditioned. They are decorated in modern style with pastel colours and wooden furniture and are in good condition. The bathrooms are of an equally good standard, but quite small.
As well as the cafe/ bar situated in the lobby area, the hotel has a large, modern restaurant on the same floor which offers an a la carte menu.
The building is a modern block built in grey stone.
The lobby is large, incorporating comfortable sofas, a lounge area with a number of tables and chairs and an open plan cafe/ bar.
This hotel is excellent for all type of travellers. 201207JG

Reports.Report: Located close to the city centre of Amsterdam, the Movenpick is located on the waterfront in a newly renovated area of downtown Amsterdam, close to Jamie Olivers Fifteen, the Panama restaurant and nightclub, and next to the Muzeikgebouw and PTA (passenger terminal for cruiseships). The city centre and Central Station are easily acessible by public transport.

The bedrooms are large and luxurious and offer all the facilities one would expect from a hotel of this calibre. They are decorated in neutral colours and have windows overlooking the city of Amsterdam or the River Ij. The bathrooms are, like the bedrooms, in very good condition

The main restaurant is the Silk Road restaurant serving all meals and located on one of the higher floors of the hotel with outstanding views. It serves an eclectic East meets West cusine and is possibly one of the largest hotel restaurants in Amsterdam with various areas decorated in varying styles but each offering a certain amount of intimacy. Their is also a bar located on the ground floor and this also serves less formal meals.
This is a modern and purpose built hotel with the distinct Movenpick logo.
The lobby is very large and incorporates numerous seating areas, an internet corner and meeting area.
This is a very good product in a new part of Amsterdam and offers the guest first class accommodation and facilities in a good location and comes highly recommended. jg/09/2010

Reports.Report: This hotel has an excellent location on the Prinsengracht, one of the nicest canals in Amsterdam, and is in the heart of the beautiful centre of Amsterdam, close to the Leidseplein with its bars and famous Holland Casino, and close to the beautiful Vondel park, Museum Square, and antique district. It is also within walking distance to all major sightseeing attractions, the main shopping thoroughfare, the Rembrandts Square and Dam Square.
The bedrooms are in good condition as the hotel only opened in April 2006. They are medium sized and offer good quality accommodation. The bathrooms are also in good condition.
This is located on the ground floor and incorporates the lobby. It serves breakfast only as there are many restaurants in the area.
This is a very attractive, traditional building, typical of Amsterdam.
The lobby is small and modern.
This hotel has an excellent location and the quality is very good as it only opened in April 2006. 040208JG

Reports.Report: Located in the very heart of Amsterdam, close to Dam Square, the Anne Frank House and all the major attractions that Amsterdam has to offer.

The bedrooms are very nice for this category of hotel and some have views over the canal, and some have small balconies. They are all in good condition although some are smaller than others. The bathrooms are also in good condition.

The breakfast room is located on the first floor and is fairly small but has a small balcony overlooking Amsterdam and the canal. This room is open all day so people can make themselves tea and coffee, help themselves to biscuits and even cook in the small kitchen if they like so long as they clean up after themselves.
The exterior is very traditional and belongs to a traditional shopping arcade and the hotel is located above these shops.
The lobby is reached by extremely steep stairs and is very small indeed.
This family run hotel has an excellent location and very friendly staff; however, the stairs at the entrance are very steep and so not ideal for everybody. 050907JG

Reports.Report: This hotel has an excellent location in the centre of Amsterdam, and, as the name suggests, is close to the Museumplein with its remarkable Rijks Museum as well as Van Gogh museum

The bedrooms are medium to large in size and are in excellent condition with wooden furniture and a terra cotta/lemon colour scheme. They all have a iron and ironing board as well as the usual facilities expected of a good 4 star hotel. The bathrooms are also in excellent condition with black slate floors and black, white and even wood furnishings.

The breakfast room is served on a split level to the reception area. This is a large room offering communal and bar tables as well as regular tables. It has a bright decor and a smoking and non-smoking section and offers a very varied choice of hot buffet items. The large bar area, which is located on the upper split level, serves a light menu available for lunch and dinner and in the summer, there is a small patio.
This is a modern, purpose built hotel

The lobby is medium in size with marble floor and modern furniture in bright blue and yellow. The area is split level (accessible by ramp as well as stairs) and leads to the hotel bar and more seating.
This is an excellent property with an excellent location and comes highly recommended. 12/11JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is situated near the city centre. The Leidseplein and Dam Square and all the major tourist attractions are directly reachable in 15 minutes by tram. The Plein 40-45 Shopping Center is located in a moment's walk from the hotel.
Both guest rooms and bathrooms vary in size and colour. They are fairly basic and could use some updating.
The breakfast room is located on the ground floor, adjacent to the lobby.
This is a modern, and fairly imposing, purposefully built hotel.

A large impressive marble lobby welcomes guests to the hotel. A large wooden Asian inspired staircase allows access to the upper floors as do the elevators. The breakfast room is easily accessible from the lobby.
This property is a good choice for both groups and individuals on a tight budget. 161007JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam, a short walk from the Amstel river, Albert Cuyp market, the Rembrandtsplein and Leidseplein. Numerous trams pass by the front door so access across town is very easy
The popular restaurant is located on the ground floor and serves a full breakfast, as well as lunch, high tea and dinner.
This is a large, traditional building with an attractive and welcoming exterior

The lobby is very cosy and welcoming with the reception consisting of two small desks. The decor is unique in as much as it depicts well worn books and luggage and their is a small seating area with internet access.

This is a fairly new hotel for Amsterdam and offers very good accommodation in a great location. The bedrooms are mainly allocated on the lower ground floor but these are more spacious than the rooms on the other floors and are superbly decorated. jg/11/11

Reports.Report: This hotel is ideally located close to the Rai Congress Centre and metro station and is within easy reach of the motorway, airport, and city centre. There is also a tram that goes to the city centre from next to the hotel in approximately 10 minutes.

The rooms are all medium in size and are very chic with a neutral beige and brown colour scheme, sofa bed, and writing desk. Soft lighting gives the rooms an almost romantic atmosphere and the new style is vastly improved compared to the former standard Novotel style.

The restaurant has benefitted from an extensive and complete renovation, like the rest of the hotel, and is now a very large but at the same time intimate space incorporating a Fusion style restaurant as well as a sushi bar; seating for single travellers which offers them their very own television screen; a private dining room; and a very trendy and popular bar area

This is a fairly high rise building in modern style - with extensive car parking - which does not reflect the standard of the interior, however, it has also benefitted from a make over and has a red bow painted on it to make it stand out.

The lobby has also been renovated and consists of individual reception desks and a seperate, large group check in reception. The main attraction is the exposed brick behind the reception area which also covers a large proportion of the lobby, along with its futuristic lighting and furniture. Their is also a snack bar and childrens play area and business centre.

This is an excellent hotel for both individuals and groups from all parts of the world and is within easy reach of downtown Amsterdam. It comes highly recommended, especially since its extensive and impressive renovation. 01062010JG

Reports.Report: This hotel consists of five historical buildings in the heart of old Amsterdam and is within walking distance of Dam square, the Royal Palace, and the Leidseplein. Amsterdam's famous shopping street, the Kalverstraat is close by as is the equally famous nightlife of the Rembrandtsplein and Leidseplein.

Some of the rooms are of a medium size whilst others are very large. Some of the bedrooms have been renovated but the plan is that they will all be done in the near future, but, in the meantime, the renovated rooms are decorated in a predominantly Bordeaux red colour scheme with pink and red splashed around the room and with light wood furniture giving it a fresh new look. The non-renovated rooms, which are in the majority, are still very functional and comfortable and not as trendy or colourful as the renovated rooms. All rooms are in good condition, as are the bathrooms.

The breakfast room is located in the basement and has also recently been renovated. It now benefits from a dark wood floor and pale wood seating giving it a modern, trendy feel. No other meals are served here as some of the best restaurants are located on the hotel’s doorstep.
The hotel’s exterior is traditional and the hotel is accessed down a couple of small steps.
The lobby is fairly small but incorporates a seating area making it seem larger. It is decorated in simple, modern style.

This is an ideal hotel for individuals with its central location and comes highly recommended. However, as of February 2007, this hotel will become a non-smoking hotel and smoking will not be permitted in the bedrooms or in any public areas. 110707NN

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam, in the trendy "Pijp" district, with its restaurants, bars, famous Albert Cuyp Market, Heineken Brewery and within walking distance of the Rai Congress Centre. It is also possible to walk to the Museumplein and Flower market although numerous trams can take you around Amsterdam and also to Central Station and Dam Square within 10 minutes.

The bedrooms are large and are all well decorated in modern style with a predominantly gold colour scheme. Many have excellent views over Amsterdam city and all are in very good condition. The bathrooms are also in very good condition. All bedrooms benefit from fax machine, internet access, isdn plug, and the renovated rooms have televisions in the bathrooms.

There are several restaurants, including the hotel's world renowned Japanese restaurants which include the Michelin starred Yamazoto restaurant. This hotel also has an elegant rooftop restaurant "Le Ciel" which has recently also been given 1 Michelin star and has amazing views of the city of Amsterdam, and also a more casual tea shop.
This is a very modern building portraying the image of a five star property.
The lobby and public areas are very comfortable and spacious, and mainly decorated by using several kinds of marble. There is a large reception desk, and a seating area of a superb quality.
This is an excellent hotel offering a very high level of service, and it is suitable for all markets. It has a fabulous spa which includes a swimming pool, saunas, gym and massage treatment. 161007JG

The bedrooms are basic but well maintained and of a decent size. The bathrooms are also to an acceptable standard.
This is a beautiful, traditional building in keeping with the other buildings in its surroundings.

This is a basic hotel with a basic accommodation but with an exceptional location.

Reports.Report: Located near the Rijks Museum, this hotel overlooks the Lido and Holland casino complex and the Hard Rock Cafe. It is only a short walk from the well-known Leidseplein with its terraced restaurants and it is within walking distance of all major tourist attractions.

The rooms are medium in size but have all been renovated in 2008 to a very high standard. They are now modern in design but also traditional, with a warm colour scheme, modern features e.g. plasma televisions, and power showers and designer beds. The bathrooms have also been renovated and are in excellent conditions. Some rooms command pleasant views overlooking the Vondelpark.

The restaurant has been completely overhauled and is now located in the front of the hotel. It is very bright with floor to ceiling windows, a modern, Italian decor and serves a very extensive breakfast. For dinner, the restaurant has a fusion Asian cuisine of top class standards with a fully open kitchen and comes highly recommended and for lunch, you can get bento boxes.
This is a traditional building which stands out from the rest of the surrounding buildings due largely to its predominantly green roof and its shape and size.

The completely renovated lobby has various areas, one incorporates a lounge with comfy furniture and a fireplace and serves a snack menu, the other is the library which has volumes of books and magazines as well as a wifi corner and a communal reading table and then you have the reception. all decorated to a very high standard. Again, like in the restaurant, floor to ceiling windows give this a very bright and airy feel but it is still very warm and inviting.
This hotel is situated in an excellent location, right in the heart of Amsterdam and comes highly recommended. jg092008

Reports.Report: Overlooking the Vondel Park, the hotel is around the corner from PC Hooftstraat, the most exclusive shopping street in Amsterdam, and within walking distance of The Van Gogh museum, Rijksmuseum, and the lively Leidseplein with casino, restaurants and bars.

The rooms are medium in size with some single rooms being smaller. All are in very good condition and offer a warm and welcoming atmosphere. They are predomintantly in a blue and beige colour scheme with a wood desk and silver mirror, while the bathrooms are pristine black and white and like the bedrooms, in very good condition. Single rooms are with shower only. All rooms are non-smoking and have air conditioning (except the single rooms).

The breakfast room is located on the lower ground floor and was renovated in 2008. It has a slate floor, black and silver seating and is very elegant. The main breakfast room leads to a beautifully kept garden where ample tables and chairs and even sofas are available, weather permitting.
The hotel is in a traditional building dating back to the late 1890s.

The lobby, bar and reception is one open area, and was also renovated in 2008. Contemporary in design with a beige, slate grey and black colour scheme there is a bar area and a very comfortable lounge area. The impressive reception desk is very large and very shiny and very black but all very welcoming.
This is a good and welcoming boutique style designer property in central Amsterdam. It comes highly recommended. 10/10/08/JG

Single rooms are with shower only. All rooms are non-smoking and have air conditioning (except the single rooms).

The rooms are medium in size with some single rooms being smaller. All are in very good condition with contemporary nautical decor offering a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Rooms are well-equipped and deluxe rooms air-conditioned. The bathrooms are also in very good condition.

Reports.Report: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam, on the beautiful Prinsen Canal, hence the name, Prinsengracht. It is within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions that Amsterdam has to offer, e.g. flower market, Rembrandtsplein, Leidseplein and Dam Square, and is also minutes from the main shopping district and a couple of tram stops from Central Station.

The bedrooms are small to medium and basic in decor but are clean, as are the bathrooms. Twin rooms consist of 2 single rooms with connecting door, and triples and quads consist of 1 double bed and sofa bed.
There is a breakfast room only which is located adjacent to the reception area/small lobby and which has recently been decorated in warm colours.
This is a traditional building in keeping with typical Amsterdam houses that line the canals of Amsterdam.
The lobby is small and incorporates the breakfast room with views of the canal. It has recently been very attractively decorated and is a welcoming haven in this exciting city.
This is a typical Amsterdam building housing a small, basic hotel in the heart of the city and perfect for those who want to be central and accommodated in a cosy, family run hotel. jg/04/2009

Reports.Report: Located in the heart of Amsterdam, 2 minutes walk from the Leidseplein with its famous Holland Casino and restaurants and bars, the famous Museumplein, home to the Rijks museum and Van Gogh museum, and the main tourist attractions of Amsterdam.

They vary in size but are mainly small but quite tasteful with pale blue and peach curtains. 50% of the bathrooms are renovated with white tiles, bath and sink. Every bedroom has a painting and each room has a plant which brightens up the otherwise normal room.
This hotel has a traditional exterior in keeping with the other buildings in this traditional neighborhood.

The small lobby also incorporates the breakfast room and has recently been renovated and is attractively decorated with wicker chairs and wooden tables with a marble floor and a large, almost floor to ceiling window which overlooks the small garden. The bar area is also incorporated in the lobby and is also very small with a couple of bar stools. The whole area is exceptionally well maintained.
There is no restaurant in this hotel due to its size and location. However it is a very popular and well sought after product. 06/2007/NN

Reports.Report: The hotel is located on the tree-lined Prinsengracht, one of Amsterdam's most picturesque canals. The Royal Palace on the Dam Square, the main shopping districts and many Museums are all an easy stroll away.

All the rooms are typically Dutch and beautifully decorated although they vary in size from small to medium; however, they have been beautifully renovated in 2000 and most have wooden floors or beamed ceilings, heavy wood furniture and are in exceptional condition. The bathrooms are also in exceptional condition and are quite stunning, with beige, checkered marble floor and sink and an arch over the bath with a crest on the wall overlooking the bath adding to the royal feel that this hotel exudes.

The restaurant is divided into two parts, one with wooden flooring and neutral furnishings and the other with marble floor and bright red, black and white furnishings. There is also a bar which is very swish with dark blue and black decor but very comfortable and inviting and it also boasts a very trendycigar room and is extremely popular with the locals and, along with the restaurant, is not typical of a hotel bar.
The hotel has a traditional exterior as it consists of 24 canal houses which have been joined together to create a unique property blending in with its historical surroundings.

Completely renovated in 1998, the medium size lobby has a checkered floor and a beautiful hand woven carpet. There are rugs and beautiful new traditional furniture and the entire area is abundant with wood, e.g. beams. A very impressive lobby.
Since its renovation in 2000, this is one of the best deluxe hotels in Amsterdam with one of the best locations, and the best bedrooms, suitable for even the most discerning traveler. 09/08/07 JG

The rooms vary in size from small to large due to the age of the building. They are modern but simple in style, although some still retain their original wooden beams which are typical of the buildings from this century. Along with the bathrooms, their condition is fair to good. A very small percentage have, however, been totally renovated in modern style, and are in very good condition.
The hotel does not have its own restaurant, but there is a breakfast room situated on the lower ground floor, with natural daylight, which can be used for groups.
It is uniquely set in four 17th century houses right on the city's most prestigious canals. The facade is typical of this distinct style.
In contrast to the traditional exterior, the small lobby is more modern, but there are still strong touches of tradition. This area also includes a cozy bar and comfortable lounge area.

This hotel is ideal for both groups and individuals wishing to experience the true character of old Amsterdam. However, please note that it is not possible for coaches to reach the entrance of the hotel so drop off will have to be in a nearby street. 170907JG

Reports.Report: This hotel offers an excellent location in the heart of the city, directly on the PC Hooftstraat, the most fashionable street in the Netherlands, home to Armani, Cartier, Tiffanys (opening end November 2009), Diesel, Louis Vuiton etc etc. It is also practically opposite the infamous Rijks Museum and around the corner to the Leidseplein, home to the Holland Casino, Hard Rock Cafe, and numerous bars, restaurants and coffee shops.

The bedrooms are very chic with either a black and gold or blue and bordeaux decor. They all have flat screen televsions, a small writing desk and are in very good condition as the hotel was completely renovated and only reopened in 2009. The bathrooms are also in excellent condition with cream bathroom suites and red tiled floors.

Due to its location, there is no restaurant in this property, however, the hotel does have a lovely, small breakfast room on the lower ground floor. It is sterile white and no expense has been spared on the cutlery and crockery.
This is a very attractive building as the exterior was also cleaned during the hotels renovation. It is in keeping with the beautiful properties found on this exclusive address.

The lobby is very, very small and the reception desk is immediately to your left upon entering the hotel, however, on the first floor, reached by very steep steps or an elevator, is a very large "living room" area where one can sit and wait for friends and colleagues, read etc.
This is a lovely small hotel in an exclusive location and comes highly recommended. 10/2009

Reports.Report: This hotel has an ideal location in the heart of the city centre, yet in a quiet, residential side street. It is within walking distance of the Leidseplein, Holland Casino, Vondel Park and the world renowned PC Hoofstraat with its designer boutiques and trendy cafes.

The rooms are in excellent condition as renovated in 2008. They benefit from up to the minute decor, furniture and fittings and offer an all-inclusive theme whereby films and mini bars are included in the room rate. The bathrooms are also in excellent condition

Their is no restaurant in this building but breakfast is served in the lounge area where there is ample seating in a relaxed atmosphere. Here you will also find complementary drinks and snacks throughout the day and a lovely small garden area.
The exterior of the hotel is traditional and in keeping with all the lovely buildings found on this street
The lobby is very small and blends in with the lounge area where breakfast is served and where guests can have a complementary drink while reading a complementary magazine or newspaper.

Reports.Report: This hotel has a wonderful location on a quiet, residential street, a few minutes walk from the Museumplein and the centre of Amsterdam. In the immediate surroundings there are lovely cafes and restaurants and boutiques which the wealthy Amsterdammers frequent.

The bedrooms are medium in size and fairly basic but in good condition, and the majority of bedrooms are with shower only, although the bedrooms located on the lower ground floor all have bathrooms and tend to be slightly larger than the other rooms. The bedrooms on this floor may be reached by a steep staircase, as the lift does not go to this floor.
The breakfast room forms part of the lobby and is fairly small but quite cosy with an outlook over the garden in the rear.
This is an attractive, traditional Amsterdam building in a traditional neighborhood.
The lobby is small and incorporates a small bar and seating area which leads to the breakfast room. There is also internet access available in the lobby for a charge.

Reports.Report: Ideally located in the "Pijp" district of Amsterdam, the Savoy may be found amongst the myriad of shops and restaurants on the fashionable Ferdinand Bolstraat, close to the Heineken brewery, the Rai congress centre, the Albert Cuyp market, the Rijksmuseum and the city centre of Amsterdam.

The bedrooms are medium to large in size and decorated in a striking black, red and green colour scheme. Art deco in style with faux leather headboards, desk with leather office chair, air conditioning and moveable, swivel televisions, the bedrooms are in very good condition and offer luxury accommodation and even offer electronic beds (the head and legs may be raised by remote control). The bathrooms are also very nicely done with white, grey and blue decor and are predominantly shower only.

Due to its location, there is no restaurant, however, the hotel serves a hot breakfast buffet in the breakfast room located on the ground floor. This is a very large room with large TV screens, a communal breakfast table as well as individual tables, and tea and coffee is available throughout the day. Small snacks are available throughout the day, also..
This is a traditional building and it is easy to walk past it as it does not resemble a hotel but there is a green awning above the entrance.
The reception area is very small but adjacent to this is a lobby area with seating, a drinks bar, magazines etc and is very welcoming.
This is a good product in the bustling "Pijp" area of Amsterdam and comes highly recommneded. 09/2010/jg

Reports.Report: The hotel is located in a quiet side street just off the Van Baerlestraat, in the best shopping area of Amsterdam. The building itself dates from the 1920's and the exterior reflects the architectural style of that era.

The lobby is medium sized and pleasantly decorated with distinct blue carpet. The lobby area leads to a cosy bar and lounge area with leather seating where smoking is permitted as it is not permitted in any of the other public areas.
This hotel is ideal for individuals or small groups due to its ideal location. jg/03/2008

Reports.Report: This hotel is located on the Spuistraat which is in the very heart of Amsterdam, within walking distance of Dam Square and the Museumplein and all the other major attractions of Amsterdam.
The bedrooms vary in size but can all be said to be medium-sized. They are green and burgundy and have pale wood furnishings and all have a desk, table and chairs and are in good condition.

The breakfast room is located on the ground floor and is very large with green carpet, burgundy furnishings and serves a sumptuous breakfast. There is also a small a la carte restaurant in the style of brasserie which is split level and made of dark wood and serves a limited menu.
This is a traditional building whose exterior has only recently been restored.

The lobby is large and bright with tiled floor and marble reception desk and windows at the back of the lobby overlooking one of Amsterdam's many famous canals. There is another lobby off the reception area with ample seating.
This hotel has a perfect location and is without doubt one of the best hotels in its class. 080908JG

Reports.Report: The hotel is conveniently located near the city centre overlooking the harbour. Schiphol Airport is approx 20 minutes from the hotel. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel offering easy access to the Central Station.

The bedrooms are in good condition and worthy of a first class hotel, although the beds consist of one base and two separate mattresses. The colour scheme of the rooms are predominantly cream with black and all have a large piece of art by the bed, hence the name of the hotel. All rooms have air-conditioning. The bathrooms are also in very good condition and are black and white with silver sink areas and gold framed mirrors, making them stand out from average hotel bathroom.

The restaurant is located on the ground floor and is also a little different to your normal hotel restaurant with purple carpet and purple chairs, artwork on the walls, beamed ceiling and a semi-circular breakfast buffet bar. It overlooks the hotel gardens and the local outdoor swimming pool.
This is a very modern building.

The lobby is medium in size and very modern, with plenty of light from the floor to ceiling windows. It is an atrium-style lobby with works of art on the walls, which are very impressive and all for sale. There is a marble floor and a marble lobby and limited, but attractive, seating. The bar is located just off the lobby and is large and in the style of a typical Dutch brown cafe with wooden floors and tables and dark brown ceilings, giving a cosy and traditional feel.
This is an excellent property, suitable for all and comes highly recommended. A great 3-star property offering trendy first class facilities and service. 190908JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is located close to the ringroad leading into Amsterdam centre, in the suburb of Osdorp. There is a tram or a bus straight to Central Station.

The bedrooms are medium in size and are in very good condition. All have a wooden writing desk, chair and room for an extra bed. The bathrooms are also in good condition but have shower only and are decorated in white with a black trim. All rooms also have air conditioning.

The restaurant is very large and is situated on the ground floor and also incorporates the bar. Due to the sheer size of the restaurant, it may be sectioned off which is good for groups who like their own area of a restaurant, and also for individuals as if the restaurant is not busy, parts are closed off by a curtain making it appear smaller and therefore more intimate.
This is a modern block.
The lobby is large with minimal seating but there is ample seating in the bar which is located behind the reception area.
This is a good hotel offering value for money.290809 JG

Reports.Report: The hotel is located in the heart of the city centre overlooking Central station and the many famous canals. It is only a five minute walk from Dam Square and approximately twenty minutes from the Rijks Museum.

The medium to large rooms are beautifully decorated in blue and yellow. Although recently refurbished, they are traditional in style. The medium sized, white tiled bathrooms are also particularly notable. Internet access and keyboards can be obtained at reception.

The hotel has a cafe overlooking the main street leading down from Central Station to Dam Square which is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and drinks and snacks and is a very informal atmosphere and popular with locals and tourists alike. The breakfast room for in-house guests is in a separate, large room which has recently been renovated and reflects a more modern theme, with plenty of sunlight and even a small, private eating room for private parties, or large families etc. The hotel also has an extremely popular bar area.
The exterior is traditional and fairly grand.

The medium sized lobby is fairly modern with marble floor and a wood reception desk. This leads to a lounge area which has recently been renovated to create a more modern and up-to-date atmosphere with modern leather seating, modern lighting and a bar area offering drinks and light snacks throughout the day. This renovation has created a very warm and welcoming lobby area.
This hotel is excellent for all types of travelers, and for both groups and individuals due to its high standard and perfect location. 291007JG

Reports.Report: This hotel is very centrally located close to the Leidseplein with its bars, restaurants and the Holland casino. The major museums are located nearby within walking distance, and so is the exclusive PC Hooftstraat shopping area.

Each room has been named after pieces of poetry written by Joost van den Vondel, closely related to the hotel. The rooms are medium to large in size. All rooms are in good condition, decorated in contemporary color schemes and well equipped. The bathrooms are in good condition.

The breakfast room is located on the lower ground floor and was completely renovated in 2005. It is now both modern and traditional in style with dark floors and lighting and pale light wood. The furniture has a traditional beige and black print and exudes a luxurious atmosphere. The hotel bar is located next to the reception and offers plenty of seating both in a bright and airy and, at the same time, cozy ambiance.
It has a traditional exterior.

The lobby was also completely renovated in 2005 with stripped wood floor and a modern reception area with a large abstract painting adorning the wall which completes the minimalist but very attractive look. There is ample seating and most of the artifacts are unique and of a nature theme.
This four star individually designed hotel offers an excellent central Amsterdam location on a quiet street. 07/07/jg

Reports.Report: This hotel is well located in the centre of Amsterdam, close to the Leidseplein, Holland casino, Kalverstraat and the PC Hoofsstraat which is the famous up market shopping street in Amsterdam. It is also close to the Museums and other tourist attractions.

The bedrooms are in very good condition and are all medium sized as they were renovated in 2004. Some have wooden flooring and are more luxurious than previously as they are catering more towards the business traveller. The bathrooms are also in good condition and the bedrooms offer some of the best 3 star accommodation that this city has to offer.
The restaurant is located in the basement and serves breakfast only. It is quite large and airy and rather attractive.
The exterior is traditional and very well maintained.

The reception area is actually very small with a slightly raised and very small seating area. However, through the bar which is next to the reception is a large lounge area which has recently been renovated and has plenty of seating and is actually very comfortable with large, checked sofas and all in very good condition. There is also a patio which can be used in the summer months only.
This is an excellent three star product with an excellent location and is suitable for all markets. Probably one of the best three star hotels in Amsterdam. 07/2004/jg
